diseases.name: Newcastle Disease
diseases.treatment: There is no specific treatment for Newcastle disease. Infected birds are usually culled to prevent spread. Vaccination programs can help reduce risk.
diseases.prevention: Vaccinate poultry regularly, maintain good hygiene practices, and avoid contact with wild birds.

diseases.name: Avian Influenza
diseases.treatment: No effective treatment for Avian Influenza in poultry. Infected flocks are typically culled to prevent further spread.
diseases.prevention: Isolate infected flocks, practice strict biosecurity measures, and limit exposure to wild birds.

diseases.name: Fowl Pox
diseases.treatment: Vaccinate healthy birds. For infected birds, isolate and treat with iodine or other antiseptics on sores.
diseases.prevention: Vaccinate poultry to prevent outbreaks, and control mosquitoes and other insect vectors.

diseases.name: Marek's Disease
diseases.treatment: No effective treatment available once infected. Vaccinate chicks on the day of hatching for prevention.
diseases.prevention: Vaccination at the hatchery, maintain strict hygiene, and separate new birds from the flock.

diseases.name: Coccidiosis
diseases.treatment: Treat with anticoccidial medications in water or feed as prescribed by a vet.
diseases.prevention: Keep litter dry, avoid overcrowding, and provide proper ventilation in poultry housing.
